name: stereospecific
content:

In a stereospecific chemical reaction, the position of the atoms within the molecules (= a unit of a chemical substance made of a group of two or more atoms) involved in the reaction controls the result: The stereospecific biochemical reactions take place in an aqueous environment. The effect of this drug has been shown to be stereospecific.
More examplesFewer examplesOne would expect these molecules to be central for the synthesis of stereospecific biomolecules. Synthetic chemists have improved reagents and reactions for difficult stereospecific syntheses. In a living organism, the membrane building blocks are synthesized with the help of these stereospecific enzymes.
